Literature Review: Scale-up of photochemical reactions has become an essential aspect of the chemical industry, as it enables the efficient production of complex organic compounds. In recent years, there has been a significant surge in the development of new photochemical and photocatalytic synthetic methods, which have been primarily employed on a small scale. However, as the demand for these compounds continues to rise, there is an urgent need to transition from lab-scale to industrial production. This review aims to summarize the advancements made in the past decade regarding the scale-up of photo-mediated synthetic transformations, with a focus on simple scale-up concepts, fundamental photochemical laws, and suitable reactor designs.
